meanings.definition: To surpass in points or score.
meanings.sent1: In the game, Sarah outpointed her opponent by scoring more points.
meanings.sent2: The team outpointed their rivals by winning the match.
meanings.sent3: The cat outpointed the dog in the race, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication outpointed all expectations, leading to her success.
meanings.sent5: The bright student outpointed the others with his perfect score.

meanings.definition: To outdo or outperform in a competition or contest.
meanings.sent1: The magician outpointed his previous performance with a new trick.
meanings.sent2: She outpointed her classmates in the science fair with her innovative project.
meanings.sent3: The chef outpointed himself by creating a dish even he couldn't resist.
meanings.sent4: The athlete outpointed his own record, setting a new personal best.
meanings.sent5: The singer outpointed the other contestants with her powerful voice.
